title: In Other News: Hospital Infected via USB Drive, EU Cybersecurity Rules, Free Security Tools
description:
Weekly cybersecurity news roundup that provides a summary of noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar for the week of June 26, 2023.

The post In Other News: Hospital Infected via USB Drive, EU Cybersecurity Rules, Free Security Tools appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: 200,000 WordPress Sites Exposed to Attacks Exploiting Flaw in ‘Ultimate Member’ Plugin
description:
Attackers exploit critical vulnerability in the Ultimate Member plugin to create administrative accounts on WordPress websites.

The post 200,000 WordPress Sites Exposed to Attacks Exploiting Flaw in ‘Ultimate Member’ Plugin appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Samsung Phone Flaws Added to CISA ‘Must Patch’ List Likely Exploited by Spyware Vendor
description:
CISA adds 6 Samsung mobile device flaws to its known exploited vulnerabilities catalog and they have likely been exploited by a spyware vendor.

The post Samsung Phone Flaws Added to CISA ‘Must Patch’ List Likely Exploited by Spyware Vendor appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: MITRE Updates CWE Top 25 Most Dangerous Software Weaknesses
description:
Use-after-free and OS command injection vulnerabilities reach the top five most dangerous software weaknesses in the 2023 CWE Top 25 list.

The post MITRE Updates CWE Top 25 Most Dangerous Software Weaknesses appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Proton Launches Open Source Password Manager
description:
Proton makes its open source Proton Pass password manager globally available for major browsers and mobile devices.

The post Proton Launches Open Source Password Manager appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: TSMC Says Supplier Hacked After Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Chip Giant
description:
LockBit ransomware group claims to have hacked TSMC and is asking for a $70 million ransom, but the chip giant says only a supplier was breached.

The post TSMC Says Supplier Hacked After Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Chip Giant appeared first on SecurityWeek.
